title: Teemu Suninen
text:
Teemu Suninen (born February 1, 1994) is a Finnish <a href="Rallying">rally</a> driver. Suninen was driving for <a href="Malcolm%20Wilson%20%28rally%20driver%29">Malcolm Wilson</a>'s <a href="M-Sport%20WRT">M-Sport WRT</a> in <a href="World%20Rally%20Championship">WRC</a> between 2017 and 2021. His manager is <a href="Timo%20Jouhki">Timo Jouhki</a>.
Rally career.
Suninen won the WRC-3 class in the <a href="2014%20Rally%20Finland">2014 Rally Finland</a> and <a href="2015%20Rally%20Italia%20Sardegna">2015 Rally Italia Sardegna</a> driving a <a href="Citro%C3%ABn%20DS3">Citroën DS3</a> R3T, and won the WRC-2 class in the <a href="2015%20Wales%20Rally%20GB">2015 Wales Rally GB</a> driving a <a href="%C5%A0koda%20Fabia">Škoda Fabia</a> S2000.
The Finn competed full-time at the <a href="2016%20World%20Rally%20Championship-2">2016 World Rally Championship-2</a> with a Škoda Fabia R5. He won at Mexico with TGS Worldwide, and at Italy and Poland with <a href="Oreca">Oreca</a>, finishing third in the drivers' championship behind <a href="Esapekka%20Lappi">Esapekka Lappi</a> and <a href="Elfyn%20Evans">Elfyn Evans</a>.
For the <a href="2017%20World%20Rally%20Championship-2">2017 World Rally Championship-2</a>, he joined <a href="M-Sport">M-Sport</a> to drive a <a href="Ford%20Fiesta">Ford Fiesta</a> R5. He scored a win at Spain and three runner-up finishes, ranking third in points behind <a href="Pontus%20Tidemand">Pontus Tidemand</a> and <a href="Eric%20Camilli">Eric Camilli</a>.
Suninen will do a double program with M-Sport in 2018, entering some races with a <a href="Ford%20Fiesta%20WRC">Ford Fiesta WRC</a> and the rest with a Ford Fiesta R5.
